metadata.title: CVE-2020-13645 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In GNOME glib-networking through 2.64.2, the implementation ofGTlsClientConnection skips hostname verification of the server's TLScertificate if the application fails to specify the expected serveridentity. This is in contrast to its intended documented behavior, to failthe certificate verification. Applications that fail to provide the serveridentity, including Balsa before 2.5.11 and 2.6.x before 2.6.1, accept aTLS certificate if the certificate is valid for any host.

criterions.comment: glib-networking: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
balsa: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
